page.title: 16RECREATIONAL FACILITIES
page.content: Four years ago, a group of children asked the Quarry Management Committee for a play area in the wood by the Quarry, but it was not possible because it would be necessary to put up a fence, so that no one could fall in the Quarry, to satisfy the Insurance Company. The Parish Council leased an area of land beside West Road from the National Trust, for the Play Area Committee. The Committee Members have been cutting down the trees (coppice) to make a track for B.M.X. bikes. They are now waiting for a tractor to come along and winch the tree stumps out. Part of the area will be used for a climbing frame and slide for the younger children. Our Headmaster is the Chairman of the Committee. Money has come from the Parish Council and from Fete Funds.
